muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>                n_1      n_2      n_3       n_4      n_5      n_6      n_7
#> sample_1 0.4893767 3.235342 1.886304  5.229786 3.573989 3.677143 3.938920
#> sample_2 6.3526144 7.346738 1.884071  4.194772 6.364490 4.210381 8.337620
#> sample_3 5.5393978 3.479682 2.659338  3.768137 4.151688 1.749977 3.617182
#> sample_4 1.7688056 5.696389 5.327889 13.002739 9.425863 8.503959 1.074577
#> sample_5 4.3066149 3.140145 1.709467  3.100020 1.338613 8.168665 4.390888
#>                n_8       n_9      n_10
#> sample_1  8.153413  9.994860 0.4957796
#> sample_2  3.107882  9.818729 7.0496992
#> sample_3  1.949670  6.281536 7.6767297
#> sample_4 13.482125  9.458880 4.2990260
#> sample_5  7.272071 12.119361 4.7151794
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
